captions.text:
JF MUSIAL: So just like Le Mans,
the Dakar Rally, or any

cross-country rally for that
matter, has different classes.

So for example, the Mini is
actually part of the prototype

class, much like the
R18 for Audi.

Yes, the Dakar Rally and the
cross-country rallies have

many more classes than Le
Mans, but it kind of
acts the same way.

So you've got the Minis, you've
got the prototypes, and

then you have things
like this.
This is a race truck.

This is kind of like
the lower class.

But it is still a competitor
in things
like the Dakar Rally.
So let's take a look.

Now, why have these
race trucks?

I didn't really understand
this until this trip.

It is a competitor
in the event.

Only competitors can help each
other while they're on stages.

So you can't have mechanics
just out there
ready to fix things.

As soon as a mechanic who is not
a competitor touches a car

and starts fixing something,
that car is
then out of the rally.

So part of the race truck class,
the category is that,
yes, this is a competitor.

There are two mechanics
and one truck
racer inside the truck.
They are competing.

If, by chance, they come across
one of their Minis that

is broken down on the side of
the road, they can stop

competing, and then they
can fix the truck.

If at no point in the rally
the Mini ever has any

problems, they're still a
competitor and they can win.
So it's pretty interesting.
So what's in this race truck?
Actually, it has a lot in it.

Well, starting from the
specifications, it has a full
race suspension.
It can go over dunes.

It's four by four, unlike the
big service trucks which is
where we're going to go next.
Four by four.

Inside it you've got tires,
you've got transmissions,

you've got differentials,
you've got any part that
you'll need to fix that car.
They don't have welders.

If you're welding something,
then pretty
much, it's game over.
But it still has parts.
So race truck.
Now let's go to the big boys.
These are the service trucks.
These are not competitors.

So the difference between the
service truck and the race

truck is this can only service
the cars while
in a staging area.

It does not go on
the race course.

As soon as it goes on the race
course and it starts helping

or supporting another vehicle,
that vehicle is
then out of the rally.
So what's in here?

Well, it's a lot like the race
truck but it has a lot more.

So for example, 48
wheels and tires.

So it's a very interesting
color
coordination system back there.

So blue is anything that
has to do with
suspension or brakes.

Black has to do with fluids,
transmission fluid, oil,
whatever it may be.

And yellow is the miscellaneous
parts.

Those are the lighter items on
the back half of the truck.

So actually, when you
come up inside--

Will, please watch your
step coming in here.

This is very, very
interesting.
So everything has its place.

Tools, parts, hardware, every
nut and bolt that you'd

conceivably need is here,
including lug nuts.

As well as it's got a generator,
it's got a welding
kit, it's got hoses, rivets.
You can fix the dampers.

This is a damper compression
system.

It's got a jack and
everything.

These trucks are filled
with parts before they
ever go on a rally.

At the workshop here
in Germany,
they're filled with parts.

They get special customs
declarations so that when they

get to a new country after
getting off the boat, they're

not spending three weeks
in customs looking
through each panel.

They get some privileges as
being a support race truck.

Now, you got to keep in mind on
things like the car, you're
on the road for two weeks.

The mechanics are living
out of this truck.

And when I mean they're living
out of this truck, I truly

mean they are living
out of this truck.
So let's come over here.

There are three people
associated with this truck,
three mechanics.

These are where their
personal items stay.
Here, here, and here.

Their bags, their clothing,
everything for
two weeks, in here.

You're going to ask, where
do they sleep?

There are tents that they
pitch on top of
the truck at night.

That's where they sleep
for two weeks.
Pretty amazing.

-You know, when you finish one
Dakar, everybody is happy.
The winners are happy.
The guy to finish is happy.
The last one is totally happy.

You want to have a target
before the start.
Me, [INAUDIBLE]

or these teams, you start from
win, and when you don't win,

you don't feel really, really
happy, but you do it.
You finish.
And also, [INAUDIBLE].

But the last one, when I started
only five from finish,

and when I finished the
Dakar, it's amazing.
But the first time--

I don't know, maybe it's
the best or not--

but the first time, I stay in
Dakar, my first feeling when I

arrive in Morocco, you know you
need to stay in Africa.

From the typical [INAUDIBLE],
and this is one of the best
moments, I think.

comments.text:
Don't just assume they had more time to make a longer video, everything has 
time constraints in the rally. Also their could have been a lot of footage 
to edit for other programs on drive. What you are seeing here takes a hell 
of alot longer to film and edit than it took to watch, remember that.
comments.author: MisterBrauer

comments.text:
Well it's a bit more complicated then that. You see the Mini cars enter the 
stage way earlier then the trucks. And the T4 trucks of the Mini team are 
at the back of the truck category, because they are not in the race to win 
the truck category. But the Mini trucks need to get as close to the Mini's 
up front as possible. So yes, even though they are heavy they will still 
actually race... i mean really peddle to the metal.
comments.author: MrWalterShow

comments.text:
Sad to hear that you apparently seem to be living in the wrong county ;-)

Dakar rally is extremely popular..

just going fast. Just like logistics is way more interesting than combat.

comments.text:
Why not have both? Is it not possible to have a presenter who loves what he 
does, knows his stuff AND is good on camera? Even JF himself can do better

Harris but he can do better than this. I'd have loved to have seen 
something of the quality of the pieces on Pagani or Koenigsegg on this 
subject.
